data.name: Brainzzz interpreter
data.description:
# Language creation : This kata (hopefully series) will explore interpreters and language creation. --- # Brainzzz : You will create an interpreter for an imaginary programming language called Brainzzz. You will have to manipulate the value of stack The operators are : 
+            ---> increment the stack += 1
-            ---> decrement the stack -= 1
*            ---> square the stack pow(stack , 2)
%            ---> find its modulus with 2
/            ---> take square root of stack which will be an integer (and floor it.i.e:remove the decimal part )
!            ---> take the factorial of stack 
(            ---> find the character at the number 
)            ---> convert a character to its corresponding ASCII code
$            ---> primality test (0 for false , 1 for true)
_            ---> end operations (everything after this is ignored)
---- # Examples : Brainzzz('+++++++--**--+++----') ---> 622 Brainzzz('+++') ---> 3 Brainzzz('----') ---> -4 Brainzzz('+++**') ---> 81 Brainzzz('++++++++++++**--/+++' ---> 146 --- # Note : You must be able to support : - factorials for large numbers - operators for large number (+ , - , * , / , %) - prime test for large numbers - The limit for max code length is 550 - Using require is forbidden
